channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tip, 8th August
item.description:
Need sign. No fly tipping. And clean up obviously

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plumstead Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Branch hanging over footpath, 8th August
item.description:
A branch is hanging over the footpath that runs parallel between Chislehurst Road and the tennis courts. It is completely blocking this footpath down to floor level. The path is used to get to and from Queen Mary’s Hospital. The best description for the position is with the tennis courts on your left walking towards the hospital it is where the footpath makes a short right turn to meet up with Chislehurst Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chislehurst Road, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lg table, 8th August
item.description:
Usual place! In fact, the other end of the road from the abandoned bicycle you promised to remove about a year ago - that is STILL there!! Imagine... you could remove both items at the same time! You have no idea how grateful we'd be in the street. : )

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, Hackney, London

item.title: 58 Hazel Way SE1 5XN flytipping again!, 8th August
item.description:
Resident at this address was seen yesterday 7th August dumping waste from her property at the back of the pathway to her house. Its not the first time. This resident and family members are constantly dumping household and garden rubbish at the back of their home with no recourse from Southwark it will continue. The unsightly and unhygienic enviroment caused by this inconsiderate resident is unacceptable. Why is Southwark council allowing this to continue? Once again the area is being littered and nothing is being done to stop it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hazel Way, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hazard: deteriorating overgrown tree, 8th August
item.description:
I am writing to formally report a deteriorating hazardous tree located in an alley just behind [8 Ridgeway East, DA15 8RZ] on public land that requires immediate attention. This overgrown tree has become a public resident safety concern due to its advanced age and potential risk of falling due to signs of structural instability, posing a severe risk to surrounding resident properties and the safety of residents in the vicinity. Due to ongoing health concerns with the tree, timely removal or maintenance is necessary to prevent potential hazards and to ensure the safety of residents in the vicinity.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Ridgeway East, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a large man made gulley running across the width of the road, 8th August
item.description:
This gulley is very deep in places. If a vehicle is parked in the kerb, cars cannot avoid this gulley. It is deep in places and could cause damage to cars or their wheels.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Cornwallis Avenue, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
